pros: Beautiful campus; excellent instructors; decent pay
Great students, beautiful campus, community resource
The location is very pretty, and staff members are nice.
cons: They pay below average. They also keep most employees part time so they don’t have to give benefits.
Students will be frustrated with you even when you explain things as simply as possible

pros: Very positive and collaborative work place.
cons: Public sector employees have different work goals than private sector.
Below median salary compared to other colleges

pros: Great place to work, best experience ever
cons: None, It was super enjoyable to work here
No room for growth or new experience.

review_title: Great place to work as a student
pros: I worked here as under the work/study program, and loved it. Everyone was very kind, and understanding if there was a big test or school event. My employers were great, and I even got to pick the department! Loved it.
cons: No discounts on parking; they used to offer a seasonal parking pass for work/study kids, because often you'll be going to work at odd hours, but they stopped doing that when the new school admin building went up, around 2013.

review_title: Great place, great people, leadership mismatch
job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Monterey, CA
pros: The campus is beautiful, coworkers are delightful, and above all the students are an absolute pleasure to be around.
cons: The leadership is mismatched to the needs of the school and is holding back the enthusiasm and creativity that have defined MPC for decades.  Many fear for MPC's future without a change at the top.

pros: Provides an  opportunity to work with educated coworkers who are well read, interested in community events and community service. Be part of a team that advances people's education and job training. Healthy and positive environment in which to work.
cons: The college does not provide health insurance for part-timers. Employees do not pay into Social Security. There are minimal opportunities for change to full-time employment or advancement

job_title: STEM CEL Tutor in Monterey, CA
pros:
Wonderful boss (Tom Rebold)
Flexible hours
Great environment
They are there to service both students and their student workers
cons: I'd feel like a hack if I had nothing negative to say, but honestly the entire experience was wonderful. If you forced me to find a negative, I'd say it was the pay, but even so the work is on campus where you already are. It's hard to

review_title: MPC is a bridge for students leading to a better life..
pros: The employees at MPC are dedicated, hard working, and committed. The faculty and support staff unions provide good leadership and communication with their members.
cons: The CA budget continues to be the great challenge as education funding is inadequate.

pros: Students are the reason teachers teach.  The students are MPC are seeking a better life through education and it is a privilege to help them succeed.
cons: Management, led by Superintendent Walt Tribley, is dishonest.  New administrators are hired with high hopes and aspirations which are quickly squelched by Dr. Tribley.  He micro manages everyone.  Those administrator candidates with fresh ideas are quickly eliminated from consideration.  The worst morale in the history of this 50+ year old college.

review_title: I was a student worker there and loved it. Staff is friendly and you can learn a lot.
pros:
Gain valuable skills
Helpful staff
nice location
cons: I wish they would hire on their student workers. The pay for the amount of work could be improved.

review_title: Great work if the administration can get out of the way
pros: Good pay, single location and great tools and shop.
cons: The endless bureaucracy leads to miscommunications and wasted time.

job_title: Engineering Content Developer in Monterey, CA
pros: Flexible hours, good people, they really care about student success
